byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Bridgewater Associates, world's biggest hedge fund, is informing recruitment firms that they must cancel interviews with prospective employees and has canceled negotiations with dozens of prospective hires; change in recruitment policy comes as number of hedge funds are cutting back in face of poor performance and disgruntled investors.

headline.print_headline: Bridgewater  Is Said to Be  Cutting Back  Recruitment
headline.main: Bridgewater, World’s Biggest Hedge Fund, Is Said to Be Slowing Hiring

snippet: The firm, which usually hires hundreds of people yearly, has canceled interviews and cut short negotiations, said people briefed on the matter....
